title: Getting kicked for not locking in
body: I keep getting kicked because I forget to lock in a pick or ban. How about we make a feature so you only have to click once, like back in the old days.

replies.body:
I don't get why it's considered a dodge if you don't lock it in.

I mean, if you select a champ and just don't lock in, it should still count.
(I've done this multiple times. Selecting a champion but forgetting to lock in because previously the timer would automatically count down for you).
is it really that hard to see the big yellow button in the bottom center of the screen

Nah, there isn't anything a typical LoL player won't complain about. :]

People who make their choice and then AFK have held up champion select in the past, so in an effort to speed things up, the current lock-in requirement was implemented.

The fact that people have picked up bad habits isn't a good excuse for them to waste everyone else's time, regardless of how little that might be.

> People who make their choice and then AFK have held up champion select in the past, so in an effort to speed things up, the current lock-in requirement was implemented.
> 
> The fact that people have picked up bad habits isn't a good excuse for them to waste everyone else's time, regardless of how little that might be.

When I run 5s, we purposely let the timer run out to give teammates a chance to finish setting up their masteries. Some people also like to consider all their options and not just lock in the first thing that they pick. 

I'm sorry you think taking a full 30 seconds to pick a champ is a waste of time?

30 x 9 = 270

When you make 9 people wait for you, you've collectively used 4 and a half minutes of their respective time. Also, 30 seconds is quite enough time to stall for an unprepared someone to finish a mastery page or for you to ponder over your champion pick. Just make sure to lock in before the clock runs out.

Come prepared, pay attention, and barring any unforeseen disasters, the new system is fine.

> 30 x 9 = 270
> 
> When you make 9 people wait for you, you've collectively used 4 and a half minutes of their respective time.

That's not how time works.

This is, in fact, how time works. It's the same way in which labor is calculated is "man-hours," as a measure of total hours spent working by all laborers.

To use an example using larger measures of time, if there are 5 people waiting to go out for lunch, and one person makes the others wait for an hour, 4 people have lost 60 minutes each. Collectively, those 4 people lost 4 hours when the wasted time is added up.

> To use an example using larger measures of time, if there are 5 people waiting to go out for lunch, and one person makes the others wait for an hour, 4 people have lost 60 minutes each. Collectively, those 4 people lost 4 hours when the wasted time is added up.

Unless you can bottle those 4 hours up and give them to one person to actually use, then only one hour was actually wasted.

There is no 'collective time'.

Ok, stop thinking about it as "time" and instead think of it in terms of, let's say, "potential yield," where "potential yield" is everything you have to gain during a given period of time, be it something material like profit or immaterial like a sense satisfaction.

10 dudes work for an hour each and make each make 1 THING, thus turning a total of 10 hours worth of potential yield into 10 hours worth of material gains. And if they instead wait around and do nothing, then those 10 hours of potential yield result in nothing.

It's like opportunity costs, only applied to "time possessed by each person."

We're not talking about ten dudes making a thing, we're talking about 10 people playing a video game. 

In which case, find a better use for your time, because if someone is spending every second of champion select doing their thing and not locking in, I'm alt tabbed watching youtube videos or chatting to a friend.

EDIT: I will say that I hate playing Hearthstone because people take their time to play their cards.

But you know what I do when I'm waiting for my turn? I fold my laundry, or draw something. My time is never wasted because I make sure it isn't.

The specifics are different, but the principle is exactly the same. Anyway, the fact that the other people have the option to alt+tab away while waiting doesn't change the fact that the champion select process is being held up.

> The specifics are different, but the principle is exactly the same. Anyway, the fact that the other people have the option to alt+tab away while waiting doesn't change the fact that the champion select process is being held up.

Nothing is stopping people from waiting until the timer has 1 second and locking in.

The fact is that there's no way to force people to lock in within a 'decent amount of time', so the fact that you get kicked while having a champ selected and just not locked in is absurd.

Those things you just mentioned are **why** the new champ select exists in its current state. Riot cannot force a player's hand to make them hurry up, so the punish passivity to promote the goal of timeliness. And for those who refuse to play along, the time limit is kept reasonably short.

Look, Riot has always kept us on a leash, it's just that now they've gone and tightened the slack, and so some can feel it chafe more so than others.
That is why there is ~30 seconds (not sure of exact time) after everyone has selected their champ before the game starts. You can also adjust masteries as subsequent people are picking.

You said that I'd probably praise you for waiting, so that's where my response came from. Anyway, what they do in the LCS and what we do down in the scrub-leagues tend to be very different things. In high-tier competitive play, they actually spend all their time discussing each pick, the comps, and strategies. That just does not happen most of the time outside of that environment.

More importantly, however, the fact that some people consider their time squandered when others make them wait while others don't think the same isn't the issue. If you're using your pick time well, then by all means, wait until the very last instant. But if you aren't, then waiting unnecessarily delays things for everyone else. That's a fact.

as a player who hasn't played for 2 years the lack of an auto lock is extremely annoying and has forced me to unintentionally dodge games where i had my champ chosen while i was picking all my sets out. the amount of time saved by forcing lock ins is minuscule compared to the amount of my time thats been wasted waiting for dodge cooldowns and forcing other people back into the que i just started the game up and in my fist match i get booted cause it didnt lock in for me. now i have to wait 5 minutes for a silly mistake, that really makes me want to start playing this game after leaving it for 2 years. i had no idea that it was changed and at first i didnt even realize it was me causing the dodges by not locking in i had to look it up on google to see wtf was wrong. why are you people so impatient its not like u have to go anywhere your here playing this game so chill out and let the game lock in for u. if you want to complain about long que times go play something else this game is toxic af anyway.
also wtf happened to your allowed to dodge one game a day with no penalty in case of toxicity?

It's the dumbest update I have seen. It's not about missing the "yellow bottom". People like to make decisions, counter pick, etc... Yet they removed the planning feature. THE PLAYERS IN RANKED CANT EVEN DISCUSS COUNTER PICKS/TRADES, ETC with this change. It is so limited. Some people like planning a lot, especially me. I highlight a character and look for other characters to see if they will be a better pick. Guess what happened? I got kicked out and put to wait for 5 mins. They never do anything to improve solo play. If anything they worsen it. I quit the moment they removed solo play. They add it back so I get back to playing. See more dumb features.  Quit again. You lost me and many other players that loved this game. These dumb changes isn't going to improve satisfactions. In the end most of us play for rank and we get 0 cared. My time and money wont be spent here anymore. Regret wasting 300 bucks in this game. Wasnt worth it in the long terms.

how about you actually lock the champion? how about you actually pay attention to the game and not just afk for no reason?
